result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeri K Hoeft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeri K Hoeft

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL NOTES: Pay Plan App rcvd.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:16am. 
Defendant Jeri K Hoeft in court with Attorney Francis P Raff.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends the Count #1 charge to Unclassified Misdemeanor Possession of THC , contrary to 961.41(3g)(e).

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Hoeft guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Hoeft on Probation for  one year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment or counseling per the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to reimburse $140 in drug buy-money
--to pay $75 in drug testing fees
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court finds that Mr. Hoeft is statutorily ineligible for expungement of this conviction.
recess 9:31am
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached (with cover letter)

Case called at 9:38 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jeri K Hoeft in court with Attorney Francis P Raff. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores with the exception of Sunset Bar & Grill solely for employment purposes
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-Booking at JCSD 
Court confirms address on file is accurate
Recess: 9:43 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 9/9/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 9/25/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
